STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 3, 2023
Alison Morrison
Shiawassee County DHHS
1720 East M-21,
Owosso, MI, 48867-9054
Re: License #: CP780201406
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
October 30, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
(3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living
with a copy of the agency’s policies and procedures
required by this rule.
One of three IL files did not have documentation the youth was provided with a copy
of the agency's policies and procedures.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
(2) The agreement must be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The agreement
must be reviewed with the youth at least once every 90
calendar days and a copy provided to the youth.
Two of three IL files did not have their agreement signed by the youth every 90
days.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Per DHHS Policy Office, Medical Passports must be generated and saved in
MiSACWIS on a quarterly basis for every youth.
• Foster parents must complete First Aid/CPR through one of the approved
methods outlined on the DCWL website and obtain a certificate.
• The business process for borrowed beds in CWLM was shared.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
CAP approved 9/28/22, was the result of the 9/16/22 renewal inspection. The
agency is in compliance with the CAP as no repeat violations were found.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed. The Chief
Administrator (CA) reported successful implementation of the 2022 CAP.
However, the agency still faces some ongoing challenges including difficulty
getting parents to engage, obtaining documentation from medical providers,
staffing changes, and the state-wide placement crisis. The CA noted that
escalating mental health needs of children has continued to make placements
challenging as there are not enough appropriate providers.
The CA reported the agency continues to work hard in efforts to overcome these
challenges. Efforts include frequent communication with staff, monthly CAP
meetings, and ongoing quality assurance practices.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed onsite. Both staff reported being satisfied with their
jobs overall and feeling supported by the agency. Staff stated their supervisors are
organized, approachable, knowledgeable, and helpful. Neither staff reported
concerns or had suggestions for improvement. One staff was relatively new to this
office as a transfer from another county. They noted several differences between
the two offices, indicating that Shiawassee was a nice change and everything was
going well.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as the 2022
review. The office continues to have adequate space for staff and clients. There is
sufficient locked storage for confidential information. No concerns were noted.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
_ __________October 31, 2023________________________
Heather A Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 2, 2023

Rorie Dodge-Pifer Date
Area Manager
4
